message.content:
cs.DL, cs.CY, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the use of Mendeley readership counts to calculate national research impact indicators. The paper discusses the use of citation counts and readership counts to assess national research performance, which falls under the category of digital libraries (cs.DL). The paper also discusses the use of social reference sharing sites like Mendeley, which falls under the category of information retrieval (cs.IR). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of data analysis and statistics to calculate national research impact indicators, which falls under the categories of cybernetics (cs.CY) and signal processing (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the use of bibliometrics to assess research impact, which falls under the category of cryptography and security (cs.CR).
